name: selenium_waits_synchronization
description: Explicit and implicit waits for dynamic content loading

args: from selenium import webdriver; from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By; from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait; from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC; driver = webdriver.Chrome(); driver.get('https://google.com'); wait = WebDriverWait(driver, 10); element = wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.NAME, 'q'))); print('Element loaded with explicit wait'); driver.quit()

expected_output.example:
Element loaded with explicit wait

Explicit wait: element appeared within 10 seconds

args: from selenium import webdriver; from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By; from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait; from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC; driver = webdriver.Chrome(); driver.get('https://example.com'); wait = WebDriverWait(driver, 10); clickable = wait.until(EC.element_to_be_clickable((By.TAG_NAME, 'a'))); print(f'Clickable element: {clickable.text}'); driver.quit()

expected_output.example:
Clickable element: More information...

Element is clickable and ready for interaction

args: from selenium import webdriver; driver = webdriver.Chrome(); driver.implicitly_wait(10); driver.get('https://example.com'); driver.find_element('tag name', 'h1'); print('Implicit wait set to 10 seconds'); driver.quit()

expected_output.example:
Implicit wait set to 10 seconds

All find_element calls will wait up to 10s
